content.question: A small sphere with charge <math alttext="positive lowercase q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is used to test the electric field produced by the relatively large charge <math alttext="positive uppercase Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> found on the surface of the sphere of a Van de Graaff generator. The small sphere experiences an electrostatic repulsion force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> due to its interaction with the large sphere. In different trials, the charge <math alttext="positive lowercase q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increased, the small sphere is placed the same distance from the large surface, and the resulting force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured. Which of the following graphs best represents <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="lowercase q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase q and the vertical axis is labeled F. The line begins near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and moves downwards and to the right at a constant rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and approximately one quarter of the way up the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase q and vertical axis is labeled F. The line begins at the origin and moves diagonally upwards and to the right.

The figure presents a graph in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase q and the vertical axis is labeled F. The line begins at the origin and curves gradually upward and to the right at an increasing rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase q and the vertical axis is labeled F. The line begins at the origin and curves steeply upward and to the right at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and at the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase q and the vertical axis is labeled F. The line begins at the top of the vertical axis above the origin and curves steeply downward and to the right at a decreasing rate, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and just above the bottom of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled lowercase q and vertical axis is labeled F. The line begins at the origin and moves diagonally upwards and to the right.
